lexUnit.name: poignant.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: evoking a keen sense of sadness or regret.

sentence.text: Rory felt a sadness more poignant and piercing than anything she 'd ever known .

Perhaps the most unbearably poignant opera of the last half-century is The Emperor of Atlantis , which was written in Theresianstadt concentration camp , while composer and librettist waited to be sent to Auschwitz .
Certainly , the most poignant part of Mr Wright 's history is the fate of the Cherokees .
The most poignant lesson , which proved to be the last , was held a few days before the wedding .
It was , by common consent , our finest and most poignant performance .
But , finally , it is the last section of the exhibition which raises most questions and provides some of the most poignant images .
He had the ability to phrase his long melodies in a particularly intense and poignant fashion , asking the violins to use bows which were ` ten feet long " .
He was briefly silent , and they both gave a moment 's attention to the incongruity of a particularly poignant song succeeding the somewhat crass commercial .
The cold-bloodedness of the quirkily named and unforgettable Pinkie remains chilling , and the ending is both climactic and everlastingly poignant : this one is a work of art .
People 's vulnerability at this time can be very great , and it is a poignant reflection on our society that there are many other people ready to prey on this .
Left at the side of the rutted washboard that has claimed so many victims , it was a poignant reminder that the desert takes a dim view of those who treat it with such disdain .
The audience , but not Tepilit , understands by now her father 's situation in Paris , so her warnings are poignant .
It is poignant , in retrospect , to consider that Nizan 's final words as a French communist writer were centred on the theme of fascist betrayal and the defence of the homeland .
The sensation was particularly poignant when the weather turned wintry .
Anna 's end is particularly poignant because there is a continuous theme of death throughout the book .
In the leading role , singer-turned-actor Dutronc has exactly the right quality of physical frailty and stooped sadness to complement Pialat 's beautiful , poignant images .
Normally he could go for weeks without being so indulgent ; but the MacQuillan case had brought Rain Morgan back into his life and with her some poignant memories .
Whilst much had changed , particularly since John Shaw 's retirement , the visit clearly brought back poignant memories of how it had all begun .
The first two days were spent in and around Jerusalem with the first poignant moment being the walk down the Mount of Olives with its magnificent views over the old city .
So why not celebrate the fact that it 's rapidly coming to an end and invest in a poignant musical reminder of 1992 … ?
In this vein , Gerald Berreman recounts the poignant success story of Kalmu , the blacksmith 's son , whom he first encountered in 1958 as a thirteen-year-old drop-out from the village school .
Charlesworth and Nathan ( 1982 ) tell a very poignant story about a young man who always wanted to be a lumberjack .
How poignant that thought seems now .
This fine psychological portrait becomes especially poignant in the final scene , in which Eliza declares her affection for him and he , though deeply moved , is incapable of responding .
Certain he would be killed , Joe recorded a poignant farewell message to Elham .
The family has poignant pictures of Sophie with the toy , and six months after she died decided to include a teddy carved into a headstone .
They came from various parts of Europe , many with poignant backgrounds and experiences of hardship and misery .
The company consists of a home brewed pack of writer/performers , and their unique blend of poignant humour with mad zane .
The now familiar , if still poignant , sight of the Albert Memorial swathed in scaffolding and plastic , is set to remain a London eyesore until at least 1996 .
A poignant or shrewd quotation may consolidate or embellish your final remarks .
